intro: Knautia decalvata, commonly known as the downy knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and foliage. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Knautia decalvata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
